docs.title: What is FansDB?
docs.text:
FansDB is invite-only crowdsourced metadata database focused on independent adult content creators and adult platforms. It runs on stash-box1 which uses perceptual hashing2 to make matching your local files to FansDB metadata very easy. It elimates the common struggle of unreliable filenames or files being in different resolution not matching.

To take full advantage of it, you just need ot install Stash3 porn organizer application. It will be able to connect directly to the FansDB. Follow their documentation4 for installation instructions.

docs.title: Accessing FansDB
docs.text:
1. Submit an application to join.
  2. Once you receive an invitation code, register an account at https://fansdb.cc/register.
  3. Login using your username (not email) and password.
  4. While logged in, click on your username at the top of the menu bar and find an API key and GraphQL Endpoint sections.
  5. Go to your local Stash and go to Settings > Metadata Providers > Stash-box Endpoints > Add.
  6. Enter the Name, GraphQL endpoint, API key and click Confirm. You can also click Test Credentials to make sure everything is correct.
  7. The endpoint is now added and can be used to scrape metadata like with any other scraper.

  1. stash-box repository ↩

  2. Perceptual hashing allows you to compare similartities between multiple multimedia files by hamming distance. Which means that despite difference in resolution, encoding or basic changes to the source file it can still be grouped together and matched easily. Read more about it here. ↩

  3. Stash repository ↩

  4. Stash installation ↩

docs.title: Networks
docs.text:
Suggest a new network

The list of networks we allow is ever expanding, but for any of them to be considered they must meet the following requirements:

  • Have to perform age verification before allowing creators to post any content.
  • Have to be individual creator focused.
    • The creator is the primary producer and participant in the content.
    • Not produced by a professional porn studio.
    • Features real life people, not drawn, animated, rendered or generated.
  • Have to be focused on original content.
  • Does not offer clips or full scenes from professional porn studios.

You can suggest them in this document and we will review it.

docs.text: Networks that were reviewed by us and met our criteria to be added to FansDB. Content from them is allowed and they can be used to verify performers age for elibility.

docs.title: Performers
docs.text:
Warning

Repeat offenders who decide to ignore comments asking for corrections will lose their EDIT privileges.

docs.title: Mandatory details
docs.text:
To create or submit a new performer, some minimum required information needs to be included.

  • Unique primary name(1)
  • Gender(2)
  • At least 1 live or defunct1 link from approved network2(3)
  • Usernames as aliases from submitted approved network2 links(4)
  1. Using FirstName LastName is preferred, but unique username can also be used.
  2. In cases where a performer identifies differently in their daily life, use the gender they use for adult content production.
  3. We rely on these networks for performer age verification.
  4. Helps avoid duplicate submissions and improves discoverability.

docs.title: Naming structure
docs.text:
1. For primary name, FirstName LastName is preferred, but unique username can also be used.
  2. Add as many relevant aliases to help match the performer.(1)
  3. Do not add legal names or private social media handles. Except in cases where the performer is using their legal name in adult content production.
  4. Each name and aliases added need to be properly sourced in the submitted links or comments.
  5. Name and alias fields are case insensitive, you should not add different capitalization variations.
  1. Relevant aliases can be social media handles, professional porn names or petnames.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
1. Only links that have a matching site can be added.
  2. Defunct links can be added and must be kept.(1)
  3. Defunct network links require additional proof.1
  4. Links that redirect to a different account, should include both links. Except in cases where they redirect to an unrelated performer.
  1. Defunct links are kept for prosperity and ability to lookup information from archives.

Tip

When adding links, make sure to click Add when adding links manually.

Suggest a site

If there is a site you would like to be added, you can suggest them in this document and we will review it.

docs.title: Images
docs.text:
1. Images main purpose is being able to identify the performer.
  2. Images must have only the performer and no other people.
  3. Try using a variety of different image shot types. From portrait shots to full body shots.(1)
  4. Do not add images where performer face is not visible. Except in cases where no pictures with performer face exists.
  5. Do not add images that have filters applied to them.
  6. Do not add animated images.
  7. Do not add image compilations/collages.
  8. Do not add images that have watermarks from unofficial sites.
  1. Main purpose of these images is being able to identify the performer. It shouldn't be used as a way to host your favorites.

docs.title: Couple accounts
docs.text:
1. An account is considered a couple account if all the content features both performers, or either of them solo, or with other people while both of them are present.
  2. In these cases, the account username should be added as alias and have a link included on both performer profiles.(1)
  1. If you can't find unique name for them, use the username of the account and include unique disambiguation to help with identification.
Example
  • Audrey with (audreyandsadie) as disambiguation.
  • Sadie with (audreyandsadie) as disambiguation.

  1. Defunct links can be added, but they require additional proof. Such proof can be a screenshot of watermarked content, social media link to a post or profile where the performer themselves promoting their account or a working archived copies of their account page (e.g. archive.org). ↩↩

  2. See Networks for a list of approved networks. ↩↩

docs.title: Scenes
docs.text:
Warning

Repeat offenders who decide to ignore comments asking for corrections will lose their EDIT privileges.

docs.title: Mandatory details
docs.text:
To submit a new scene, some minimum required information needs to be included.

  • Title
  • Date(1)
  • Credited or mentioned performers
  • Studio
  • Perceptual hash (pHash)1
  1. Required by the software. In cases where date is not known, use placeholder 1970 or 1970-01-01.

docs.title: Titles
docs.text:
Due to networks not having a set structure, use the following order to decide which one applies to your case:

  1. Official title(1)
  2. User generated title
  3. Title adapted from the description
  4. A combination of username and date
  5. Username

Limitations:

  1. Do not add titles that have Unicode characters used for stylistic purpose.(2) Except for emojis.
  2. Titles must be contained to a single line.(3)
  1. In cases where the official title is not in English, a translated version needs to be added to the details section.
  2. This is to prevent various Unicode characters that use weird fonts. Different characters from various alphabets is allowed.
  3. Some sources can have titles span multiple lines. This is not shown in the Details tab, but the fully rendered title is visible in the Confirm tab.

docs.title: Dates
docs.text:
1. Valid date formats are YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM or YYYY.
  2. In cases where the scene was released multiple tiles, the earliest known date should be used.
  3. In cases where date is not known, use placeholder 1970 or 1970-01-01.
  4. In cases where date is in conflict due to timezones, use UTC as a baseline.

docs.title: Performers
docs.text:
1. All credited or mentioned performers must be added.(1)
  2. Uncredited performers can be tagged with an appropriate missing performer meta tag.2(2)
  3. Mainstream or guest performers who don't have an account on FansDB approved network should be omitted.3(3)
  1. Performers must meet mandatory performer requirements.
  2. Adding these tags are optional, but very helpful.
  3. This can often happen with professional studios that re-distribute their content on these independent creator platforms without performers having personal accounts.

docs.title: Studios
docs.text:
1. The selected studio must use the account name, not the network name.
  2. In cases where content is watermarked by the network, the selected studio must match the account name of that watermark.
Example
  • OnlyFans (network) is a network.
  • _boyo_19 (OnlyFans) is a studio.

docs.title: Details
docs.text:
1. In cases where scene description is not in English, add a translated version below it.
  2. Do not add details that have Unicode characters used for stylistic purpose.(1) Except for emojis.
  1. This is to prevent various Unicode characters that use weird fonts. Different characters from various alphabets is allowed.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
1. Only links that have a matching site can be added.
  2. Defunct links can be added and must be kept.(1)
  3. Studio links that are different from the selected studio and doesn't match the watermark can be included if they are from the same network.
  1. Defunct links are kept for prosperity and ability to lookup information from archives.

Tip

When adding links, make sure to click Add when adding links manually.

Suggest a site

If there is a site you would like to be added, you can suggest them in this document and we will review it.

docs.title: Cover images
docs.text:
Due to networks not having a set structure, use the following order to decide which one applies to your case:

  1. Studio provided cover
  2. User generated cover
  3. Scene thumbnail
  4. No cover

Limitations:

  1. Do not add animated, drawn, 2D or 3D covers.
  2. Do not add cover images that have watermarks from pirate sites.(1)
  1. Blurred, cropped or otherwise hidden watermarks are acceptable.

docs.title: Content distribution
docs.text:
1. In cases where scenes are distributed on multiple networks or, different accounts must have separate entries for each of them.
  2. In cases where scenes from approved networks are later distributed on unapproved platforms are permissible.

docs.title: Duplicates
docs.text:
1. Scenes that are identical and released on the same account and same approved network need to be merged into one and submitted with the earliest known metadata. Links from those secondary releases can be added to the primary scene.
  2. Scenes that are identical and released on a different account, but on the same approved network, should have separate entries.
  3. Scenes that are identical but released on different account and different approved network should have separate entries.

docs.title: Trailers
docs.text: 1. Promotional trailers that are posted on the studio are allowed, but should be tagged with an appropriate meta tag.4

docs.title: Forbidden content
docs.text:
1. Animated, drawn, 2D or 3D scenes.

  1. Perceptual hash (pHash) can be generated in Stash by enabling Generate perceptual hashes option in Settings > Tasks. ↩

  2. These tags are: Missing Performer (Female), Missing Performer (Male), Missing Performer (Trans). ↩

  3. These scenes can be optionally tagged with Unverified Performer tag and mention the performer's name in the scene details. ↩

  4. Tag: Trailer. ↩

docs.title: Studios
docs.text:
Warning

Repeat offenders who decide to ignore comments asking for corrections will lose their EDIT privileges.

docs.title: Mandatory details
docs.text:
To create a new studio, some minimum required information needs to be included.

  • Name
  • Network
  • Live or defunct1 link from approved network2

docs.title: Names
docs.text:
1. username (network) is the required format.(1)
  2. Official capitalization of usernames must be preserved.
  3. Network name capitalization must match the official spelling.
  4. Do not use abbreviations for studio or network names.
    • username is the part used in the link or after @, not the display name.
    • @ should not be included as part of the name.
Example

See studios page for properly named studios for an example.

docs.title: Networks
docs.text:
1. Select an appropriate network to match the one used in the name field.
  2. Do not create new networks.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
1. Only a single link matching the name of the account should be added.
  2. Defunct link requires additional proof.1
  3. Do not add any additional links.(1)
  1. No social media, related VIP/non VIP links, links from different networks, etc.

Tip

When adding links, make sure to click Add when adding links manually.

Suggest a site

If there is a site you would like to be added, you can suggest them in this document and we will review it.

docs.title: Images
docs.text:
1. Images are optional.
  2. If added, images must contain performer username, name, official brand or some other identifiable text on top of it.(1)
  3. In cases where official logo exists, it should be used and kept.
  4. User generated, or composed images are welcome.
  5. In cases where the performer has multiple studios, please use unique images for each of them. Except when it's an official logo.
  1. Plain performer images are better suited for the performer profile instead.

docs.title: Multiple accounts
docs.text:
1. Performers that use multiple networks or accounts must have a separate studio for each of them.
  2. Removed or renamed accounts must also have a separate studio.

  1. Defunct links can be added, but they require additional proof. Such proof can be a screenshot of watermarked content, social media link to a post or profile where the performer themselves promoting their account or a working archived copies of their account page (e.g. archive.org). ↩↩

  2. See Networks for full list of approved networks. ↩

docs.title: Tags
docs.text:
Warning

Repeat offenders who decide to ignore comments asking for corrections will lose their EDIT privileges.

docs.title: Mandatory details
docs.text:
To create a new tag, some minimum required information needs to be included.

  • Name
  • Description
  • Category

docs.title: Descriptions
docs.text: 1. Description should be narrow in scope.

docs.title: Aliases
docs.text:
1. Avoid adding niche aliases that are unlikely to be used by multiple people.
  2. Aliases need to be as narrow in scope as possible.

docs.title: Categories
docs.text: 1. Choose the category that best fits the tag.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
1. Do not bulk import tags.
  2. Do not blind copy tags from other sources.1

  1. StashDB might be a good source on its own, but their sourcing methodology doesn't match ours. ↩

docs.title: Guidelines
docs.text:
We have a specific structure and guidelines around how we store the metadata on FansDB. Some aspects might seem unnecessary or repetitive, but we do so to keep uniformity across a wide range of different sites.

So please take a moment and read through the guidelines if you plan on contributing. It will save you and us a lot of time and frustration in the future.

  • Performers

    All relevant guidelines related to performers.

    Go to page

  • Scenes

    All relevant guidelines related to scenes.

    Go to page

  • Studios

    All relevant guidelines related to studios.

    Go to page

  • Tags

    All relevant guidelines related to tags.

    Go to page

  • Networks

    All relevant guidelines related to networks and sites allowed on FansDB.

    Go to page

docs.title: Guides
docs.text:
This section covers official FansDB guides, primarily in relation to Stash application.

If you find the guide has a typo or is outdated you can submit a pull request to fix it or make an issue on the GitHub. Thank you!

docs.title: Scraping scenes via FansDB
docs.text:
There are several ways to scrape scenes from FansDB via Stash. From automatic to manual. Each has its own advantages and disadvantages.

  • Tagger (recommended) - partially automatic, great accuracy
  • Identify - fully automatic, mediocre accuracy
  • Scrape with... - fully manual, great accuracy

docs.title: Enable perceptual hashes (pHash)
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Tasks.
  2. Under Library heading you will find configuration options for Scan task and Generate task.
  3. Enable Generate perceptual hashes under Scan heading.
  4. Enable Perceptual hashes under Generate heading.

Scan task and its options are applied when the content is being added to the database the first time.

Generate task and its options are applied when you want to generate additional things for content that is already in your database.

docs.title: Configure FansDB endpoint
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Metadata Providers.
  2. Under Stash-box Endpoints heading click Add and include the details of FansDB stash-box instance.
  3. Click Test Credentials to make sure everything is correct.

docs.title: Tagger
docs.text:
Recommended to people that value accuracy the most. It can automatically go through scenes and match them based on perceptual hash, but object creation and verification is left to you and nothing is saved until you click Save.

  1. Go to Tagger, which accessible from the toolbar.
  2. Under Source select FansDB instance.

  3. Opposite the Source click on the to open configuration.

    1. You can enable Show male performers if you want them to be scraped for you locally.
    2. You can disable Set scene cover image if you prefer to keep your existing cover.
    3. You can enable Set tags if you want to be shown all the crowdsourced tags the scene has on the FansDB instance.

    4. You can enable Mark as Organized on save which will apply Organized flag.

      Organized flag

      Organized flag has a technical purpose in addition to being able to be used in a filter. All objects marked as organized will be ignored by automatic tasks like Identify and Auto Tag.

  4. Click on Scrape All and look through the results. Add missing objects and click Save.

    1. If you got returned No results found, you can try using query method. You can enter title, performer, release date, or studio and click Search. Keep in mind that sometimes fewer details, are better.
    2. If you know the scene exists on FansDB instance, but it wasn't found, you can input the exact StashID in the Query field, click Search and it will return that exact scene.

  5. For scenes that you clicked Save on, you can submit your file fingerprints (hashes) back to the instance to help improve the accuracy. Scroll to the top and click Submit x fingerprints.

    Fingerprints

    All fingerprints are tied to the user API key, no other information is sent to the FansDB instance. Privacy is paramount.

docs.title: Identify
docs.text:
For people that want fully automatic option and don't mind some potential inaccuracies. The task will automatically go through all scenes and match them based on perceptual hash. You can also create all missing objects automatically. No manual verification is possible.

Warning

Task is irreversible, so it's a good idea to make a backup before running it.

  1. Go to Settings and enable Advanced Mode.
  2. Go to Settings > Tasks.
  3. Under Library heading click on Identify....

  4. Under Sources select FansDB instance to match against.

    Info

    Identify task iterates through sources until it finds a match, once it finds a match, it will ignore all other sources for that scene.

  5. Configure default options that will apply to all sources (they can be overwritten for individual sources by clicking next to each source).

    1. You can disable Show male performers if you don't want them to be scraped for you locally.
    2. You can disable Set scene cover image if you prefer to keep your existing cover.
    3. You can enable Set organized flag which will apply Organized flag.
    4. You can disable Skip matches that have more than one result if you don't mind potentially getting more mismatched results. If enabled, it can also be tagged with a custom tag to let you know which scenes were skipped.
    5. You can disable Skip single name performers with no disambiguation if you don't mind potentially getting more mismatched results. If enabled, it can also be tagged with a custom tag to let you know which scenes were skipped.
  6. Click Set as default to save your configuration.
  7. Configure default field options that will apply to all sources (they can be overwritten for individual sources by clicking next to each source).
  8. Click Set as default to save your configuration.
  9. Click Identify to start the task.

docs.title: Scrape with...
docs.text:
In addition to previous methods, there is also a completely manual way to match scenes individually.

  1. Go to a scene you want to match.
  2. Click on the Edit tab.
  3. Click Scrape with... and select FansDB instance to match against.
  4. Check the return results, create missing objects and click Apply.
  5. Click Save.

Modified from Scraping scenes via stash-box lincensed under CC-BY-SA-4.0.

docs.title: Submitting content to FansDB
docs.text:
There are several types of content that can be submitted to FansDB.

  • Performers
  • Scenes
  • Studios
  • Tags

There are also several methods for submitting content. Some require Stash application1 others can be done directly from the FansDB site or both.

docs.title: Performers
docs.text:
Warning

All performer submissions have to meet FansDB guidelines and minimum required information threshold.

docs.title: Via Stash application
docs.text:
1. Open your local Stash.
  2. Go to Performers page.
  3. Open performer profile you want to submit.
  4. Click Submit to Stash-Box and select FansDB as a stash-box endpoint.
  5. Click Submit.
  6. Now go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Drafts.
  7. Click on Performer addition: <performer name> link.

  8. Check over the pre-filled details and look if there is any unmatched data.

    Info

    The data between Stash and FansDB has to be translated due to different database structure, so not all data fields are supported to be automatically translated and pre-filled.

    Add all unmatched URLs

    You can add unmatched URLs with a single click by using a userscript. With the userscript installed you will see add urls button next the unmatched URLs section to add all approved matching links automatically. You might need to refresh the page to see the button. Huge time saver.

    Userscript repository | Click to install

  9. Fill in the the unmatched data.

  10. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  11. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Via FansDB site
docs.text:
1. Go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Performers.
  2. Look for Create button and click it.
  3. Fill in all the details you have in Personal Information, Tattoos and Piercings, Links and Images tabs.
  4. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  5. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Scenes
docs.text:
Warning

All scene submissions have to meet FansDB guidelines and minimum required information threshold.

docs.title: Prerequisite: Enable perceptual hashes (pHash)
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Tasks.
  2. Under Library heading you will find configuration options for Scan task and Generate task.
  3. Enable Generate perceptual hashes under Scan heading.
  4. Enable Perceptual hashes under Generate heading.

Scan task and its options are applied when the content is being added to the database the first time.

Generate task and its options are applied when you want to generate additional things for content that is already in your database.

docs.title: Via Stash application
docs.text:
1. Open your local Stash.
  2. Go to Scenes page.
  3. Open scene you want to submit.
  4. Click and select Submit to Stash-Box.
  5. Select FansDB as a stash-box endpoint.
  6. Click Submit.
  7. Now go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Drafts.
  8. Click on Scene addition: <scene name> link.
  9. Check over the pre-filled details and look if there is any unmatched data.
  10. Fill in the the unmatched data.
  11. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  12. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Via FansDB site
docs.text:
Info

It is not possible to submit a scene via the site because FansDB requires a perceptual hash (pHash) as part of the minimum details.

docs.title: Studios
docs.text:
Warning

All studio submissions have to meet FansDB guidelines and minimum required information threshold.

docs.title: Via FansDB site
docs.text:
1. Go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Studios.
  2. Look for Create button and click it.
  3. Fill in all the required details in Details and Links tabs. Add optional image in Images tab.
  4. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  5. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Tags
docs.text:
Warning

All tag submissions have to meet FansDB guidelines and minimum required information threshold.

docs.title: Via FansDB site
docs.text:
1. Go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Tags.
  2. Look for Create button and click it.
  3. Fill in all the details according the the naming structure of FansDB.
  4. Leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  5. Click Submit Edit.

  1. https://github.com/stashapp/stash ↩

docs.title: Updating content on FansDB
docs.text:
There are several types of content that can be updated on FansDB.

  • Performers
  • Scenes
  • Studios
  • Tags

There are also several methods for updating content. Some require Stash application1 others can be done directly from the FansDB site or both.

docs.title: Performers
docs.text:
Warning

All performer updates have to meet FansDB guidelines.

docs.title: Via Stash application
docs.text:
1. Open your local Stash.
  2. Go to Performers page.
  3. Open performer profile you want to submit an update to.
  4. Make sure the performer has StashID associated with FansDB.
  5. Click Submit to Stash-Box and select FansDB as a stash-box endpoint.
  6. Click Submit Update.
  7. Now go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Drafts.
  8. Click on Performer update: <performer name> link.

  9. Check over the pre-filled details and look if there is any unmatched data.

    Info

    The data between Stash and FansDB has to be translated due to different database structure, so not all data fields are supported to be automatically translated and pre-filled.

    Add all unmatched URLs

    You can add unmatched URLs with a single click by using a userscript. With the userscript installed you will see add urls button next the unmatched URLs section to add all approved matching links automatically. You might need to refresh the page to see the button. Huge time saver.

    Userscript repository | Click to install

  10. Fill in the the unmatched data.

  11. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  12. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Via FansDB site
docs.text:
1. Go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Performers.
  2. Look for a performer you want to update and open the profile.
  3. Click Edit.
  4. Fill in the additional details or correct incorrect details.
  5. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  6. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Scenes
docs.text:
Warning

All scene updates have to meet FansDB guidelines.

docs.title: Via Stash application
docs.text:
1. Open your local Stash.
  2. Go to Scenes page.
  3. Open scene you want to update.
  4. Make sure the scene has StashID associated with FansDB.
  5. Click Submit to Stash-Box and select FansDB as a stash-box endpoint.
  6. Click and select Submit to Stash-Box.
  7. Select FansDB as a stash-box endpoint.
  8. Click Submit Update.
  9. Now go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Drafts.
  10. Click on Scene update: <scene name> link.
  11. Check over the pre-filled details and look if there is any unmatched data.
  12. Fill in the the unmatched data.
  13. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  14. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Via FansDB site
docs.text:
Warning

All scene updates have to meet FansDB guidelines.

  1. Go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Scenes.
  2. Look for a scene you want to update and open it.
  3. Click Edit.
  4. Fill in the additional details or correct incorrect details.
  5. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  6. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Studios
docs.text:
Warning

All studio updates have to meet FansDB guidelines.

docs.title: Via FansDB site
docs.text:
1. Go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Studios.
  2. Look for a studio you want to update and open it.
  3. Click Edit.
  4. Fill in the additional details or correct incorrect details.
  5. Go to Confirm tab and leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  6. Click Submit Edit.

docs.title: Tags
docs.text:
Warning

All tag updates have to meet FansDB guidelines.

docs.title: Via FansDB site
docs.text:
1. Go to https://fansdb.cc and click on Tags.
  2. Look for a tag you want to update and open it.
  3. Click Edit.
  4. Fill in the additional details or correct incorrect details.
  5. Leave a comment that explains where your details are coming from.
  6. Click Submit Edit.

  1. https://github.com/stashapp/stash ↩

docs.title: Launch of FansDB Docs Site
docs.text: The documentation site was offically launched with the initial guidelines.

docs.title: Performers
docs.text:
1. Age and Verification 1.1. Performers must be at least 18 years old and verified by at least one approved content distribution platform. 1.2. Performers must have still active or previously active account on at least one approved content distribution platform.

  2. Link Requirement for New Performers 2.1. New entries for performers must contain at least one link from the approved content distribution platforms (aka networks).

  3. Naming Conventions 3.1. A performer's primary name should be their most recognized one. 3.2. Other names or handles can be added as aliases.

docs.title: Scenes
docs.text:
1. Submission Details 4.1. At a minimum, details must include performers, studio, and hashes (including pHash).

  2. Titles 5.1. Titles, though not mandatory, are preferred. 5.2. Use the official title when available. 5.3. In the absence of an official title user made title that reflect the content can be used. 5.4. If no official or user made title is used: you can use use a combination of date + username or just the username if the date is unavailable.

  3. Dates 6.1. While not mandatory, dates are preffered. 6.2. Valid date formats are YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD. 6.3. Use 1970 or 1970-01-01 if the date is unknown.

  4. Origin and Distribution 7.1. Scenes from approved platforms that are later sold on pay-per-video platforms are permissible.

  5. Multiple Entries 8.1. Scenes distributed on multiple platforms or accounts should have separate entries.

docs.title: Studios
docs.text:
1. Network Additions 9.1. Avoid adding new networks. 9.2. Instead, create a sub-studio under an existing network.

  2. Naming Conventions 10.1. Studio names should use the performer's username from the approved platform. 10.2. Avoid using the '@' symbol and the performer's actual name.

  3. Link Requirement for New Studios 11.1. New studio entries must contain a link from the approved platform.

  4. Formatting 12.1. Use the format: username (network) for naming studios. 12.2. Network name should match the spelling used in FansDB. 12.3. No abbreviations for the names should be used.

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: To Be Determined (TBD)

docs.title: Platforms
docs.text:
• AdmireMe
  • Fancentro
  • Fansly
  • Fansoda
  • JustForFans
  • LoyalFans
  • MYM
  • OnlyFans
  • Privacy

docs.title: How to Join FansDB?
docs.text:
Add a section on how to join FansDB.

  1. Submit an application to join.
  2. Once you recieve an invite code, register an account at https://fansdb.cc/register.
  3. Login using your username (not email) and password.
  4. While logged in click on your username at the top of the menu bar and find an API key and GraphQL Endpoint sections.
  5. Go to your local Stash and go to Settings > Metadata Providers > Stash-box Endpoints > Add.
  6. Enter the Name, GraphQL endpoint, API key and click Confirm. You can also click Test Credentials to make sure everything is correct.
  7. The endpoint is now added and can be used to scrape metadata like with any other scraper.

docs.title: Big Change with FansDB
docs.text:
After some internal discussions, we decided to expand the scope of approved platforms on FansDB. This would extend to pay-per-view (PPV) content of already approved platforms that was previously not allowed.

New requirements for platforms are:

  1. Have to perform age verification before allowing creators to post any content.
  2. Have to be creator focused and not a mainstream porn studio.
  3. Have to be focused on original content.
  4. Does not offer free videos of unverified users or clips from mainstream porn studios.

We hope this change will solve several issues:

  • Expand the pool of performers that can be added.
  • Make deciding if content fits on FansDB more user-friendly.
  • Make checking and voting easier and save precious time.

This will lead to increased overlap with StashDB, but their structure of amateur studios is very different from ours (they place all content from the amateur performer under a single studio, no matter the platform it came from) so we think it's a benefit overall.

As of now, these changes remove all content restrictions from all existing approved platforms Fancentro, JustForFans, LoyalFans and ManyVids (except for animated, drawn, 2D and 3D content) and add new platforms CamSoda, Chaturbate, MFC Share.

See Platforms for full list. Suggest new platforms for consideration here.

docs.title: New Domain
docs.text:
As many of you might now, we had a lot of issues with .xyz domain so to try to mitigate those issues we bought new domain fansdb.cc.

Both domains will operate for the moment, but the new fansdb.cc domain will be the main one moving forward. Old fansdb.xyz domain will expire on 2024-05-01 and won't be renewed after that.

docs.title: FansDB scope expansion and new platforms
docs.text:
After some internal discussions and a non-binding public poll where majority of people voted in favor of allowing only pay-per-view (PPV) platforms, we decided to expand the scope of approved platforms on FansDB once again.

Until now we allowed platforms that have subscription based distribution model or subscription + something else (e.g. ManyVids is primarily pay-per-view (PPV) site, but they do offer subscription based content with their Clubs feature).

As of now we are removing the content distribution model from the consideration. Be it subscription, pay-per-view (PPV), cam recording or something else it will be allowed if it passes remaining requirements. We know that the metadata available differs depending on the distribution model, so while we are keeping the minimum submission requirements the same, we hope that if more metadata is available it gets added.

Requirements for platforms to be approved are:

  1. Have to perform age verification before allowing creators to post any content.
  2. Have to be individual creator focused.
    1. The creator is the primary producer and participant in the content.
    2. Not produced by a professional porn studio.
    3. Features real life people, not drawn, animated, rendered or generated.
  3. Have to be focused on original content.
  4. Does not offer clips or full scenes from professional porn studios.

You can check Banned Platforms to see an example of platforms that don't meet our requirements.

docs.title: New Approved Platforms
docs.text:
• Fanplace
  • FC2
  • Frisk

See Platforms for full list of approved and banned platforms. Suggest new platforms for consideration here.

docs.title: Revamp of the Docs
docs.text:
As some of you might have noticed we revamped the docs site to make it more functional and easier to navigate.

Some of the changes:

  • Light/dark theme
  • Search
  • GitHub comments under news articles
  • Showing the creation/update GitHub date and contributors at the end of the pages.

We are adding a RSS feed and JSON feed support, so you can subscribe via your reader of choice to stay better informed. There are 2 feeds. One is for newly created pages, another one for updated pages.

Direct link to feed_rss_created.xml RSS feed. Direct link to feed_rss_updated.xml RSS feed. Direct link to feed_json_created.json JSON feed. Direct link to feed_json_updated.json JSON feed.

docs.title: Guidelines structure update
docs.text:
With more and more new users joining in and starting to contribute, this is a perfect time to hopefully make the guidelines more readable and easier to follow.

Notable changes:

  • Each guideline page now has section that explicitly states mandatory details.
  • Platforms were renamed to Networks.1
  • While the guidelines remain the same, the wording of some of them was changed.

Until now, I have been more lenient with small mistakes like missing aliases, improper images or defunct links and fixing them myself after approving them. But at the current pace it is becoming too much work, so I will be enforcing the guidelines more strictly now.

So please take a minute and review the updated guidelines to re-familiarize yourself.

  • Performers
  • Scenes
  • Studios
  • Tags
  • Networks

If you have any suggestions or questions leave the below in the comments or on Discord.

  1. This was done to match the stash-box software terminology, as all the values are hard-coded. ↩
